A womanâ€™s guide to getting older and feeling damn good while doing it!

 

How to get older and be happy.

 

 

How to get more youthful skinÂ 

 

Basic cosmetic procedures that are the least expensive and would be a natural progression after skin care. Compared to products, cosmetic procedures are not a commodity so finding bargain cosmetic procedures may not be a good thing.

Weâ€™re talking about wounding the skin, and this doesnâ€™t necessarily correlate with cheaper. However, there is no reason you canâ€™t call around to your local dermatologists or plastic surgeons to find out what procedures cost.

Then you can compare for yourself. I pick three or four good doctors or medical spas in my area and check their prices, and then I get on their email list. Before long, I get discounted offers of up to thirty percent off their procedures.

Itâ€™s worth it to compare and get on their lists. Youâ€™ll get weekly emails from all the places you signed up at to compare the prices. You can even call your favorite doctor or spa and ask if they will match prices. They do it all the time!

Botox â€“ You should get Botox as a prevention measure. You may only need twenty units or so just to prevent frown lines or lines that may be forming between your nose and eyes called the elevens.

You can also have Botox used on your crowâ€™s feet (the lines around your eyes). This helps tremendously. If you need thirty or forty units and you canâ€™t afford it all at once, then get ten units every few weeks until you get all areas covered.

The cost varies, but I have paid up to fourteen-dollars a unit. When I got on the doctorsâ€™ or Spa lists, I received discounts, and now I only pay about nine to ten dollars per unit. Thatâ€™s a pretty good savings. Some doctors will have a buy two get one free promotion.

Also, there are competing products to Botox. Because theyâ€™re competing with Botox, they may be less money. Botox, which is owned by Allergen, has a loyalty program, as well. I recently received a coupon for $100 off the total cost of my Botox!

This program is called BRILLIANT DISTINCTIONS. Make sure you sign up or have your doctor/injector sign you up and every time you get Botox or another Allergan product such as Juvederm, etc. you will receive points towards your next service.

I almost got my most recent Botox for free by doing this.

Chemical Peel â€“ A chemical peel is great for removing the surface layer of the skin. The process wounds the skin, which causes it to heal itself by creating new collagen. A chemical peel has different strengths so the cost will vary. Â You can do it at home. Â Check out my course (https://how-to-get-smoother-skin.teachable.com)

In most states, a chemical peel will cost about $150 to Â $200 in a doctorâ€™s office. Youâ€™ll want to continue having peels, as they will help create beautiful skin with less texture and, diminish fine lines.

You can do them yourself, but start with a low strength. Â Unfortunately, in my learning process, I bought a fifty-percent TCA peel online (I should not have been able to purchase this strength peel without a license), and I did some serious damage to my skin. Damage so bad that, I have to hide the scars every day for three years. Itâ€™s not the worth the risk to try and skip ahead rather than to start slow or let a professional do it.

If you want to do your peel, start with a small patch of skin to see how it will react. I do my own peels every two to four weeks, usually no more than twice a month. You can go to skin-peel.com to find them.

The secret to making peels comfortable is while they are on your face, use your blow dryer on the cool setting or, use a small hand fan pointed at your face. It makes a difference.

Retin-A â€“ A prescription is required, but Retin-A is fantastic!! â€œRetin-A (tretinoin) is a topical preparation of vitamin A, which has antioxidant properties, just like the vitamin by itself. Itâ€™s an acid derivative of retinol (vitamin A).

The important aspect is the effectiveness of what Retin-A does. Studies have shown that Retin-A can help reduce wrinkles, reduce acne, exfoliate dead skin cells and redistribute melanin. Melanin redistribution results in lighter, more even skin color. Thus Retin-A is often used to treat skin discolorations caused by excessive sun exposure.

If you have sensitive skin, it may not work for you, it may be too harsh, but there are alternatives with lesser concentrations. Â I would still try to mix a little every other night with my favorite cream. Just donâ€™t give up. This stuff is amazing! Â I heard it said that anyone with a pulse and a credit card should use Retin-A.

Get Retin-A for less at GOODRX.COM

Teeth Whitening â€“ This makes a huge difference. You could have perfect skin and straight teeth, but if your teeth are stained and dull, no one will notice anything else. If you have bright, white teeth, youâ€™ll look better, and younger, and feel better too. Â 

The cost in my state is about $100.00, which is down from $500 when I first had it done. There are many good ones over the counter too.

IPL-, which stands for intense pulse light or flash lamp therapy, is a noninvasive and non-ablative treatment that uses high intensity pulses of visible light to improve the appearance of birthmarks, port wine stains, broken facial veins, rosy cheeks, rosacea, red thread veins of the legs, freckles, age spots, facial lines and wrinkles, and the removal of unwanted dark hair. The procedure is referred to as photo rejuvenation and requires a series of treatments. Â I can tell you personally that it doesn’t work on legs ğŸ™

The cost nationally runs about $100 to $300. You should only need a few treatments. I have seen it as low as $80 per treatment if you agree to three or more.

Â Itâ€™s important to know that brown spots on the body are hard to remove. Â I add a skin bleach and put a little of my skin peel on each spotÂ when I do peels on my face. Â It takes a long time and staying out of the sun maintain my treatment.

Dermapen or Micro-Needling â€“ â€œ Sterile surgical stainless micro-needles pierce the skin leading to apoptosis of cells in the dermis.â€ â€œWhat is Apoptosis? Apoptosis or programmed cell death is when a cell essentially commits suicide. This process is natural, controlled and routine. Little inflammation is caused.â€ â€œThe Dermapen uses eleven, 33-gauge micro needles to stimulate the dermis. Needles vertically pierce the skin to enhance rejuvenation results. Small holes are punctured at a rate of 1000/second.Â This proliferation of the bodyâ€™s tissue continues to release growth factors from fibroblasts, keratinocytes, and monocytes.â€

Note: I have had Dermapen about six times and it works wonders. Itâ€™s comparable to lasers like Fraxel but without all the downtime and expense. Many doctors will give you a discount if you buy a package of four or more. You can save hundreds by doing this. I paid $150 per treatment vs. $300 â€“ $350 by buying the package.

Juvederm â€“ Juvederm is an injectable filler consisting mostly of hyaluronic acid. Itâ€™s used to fill in areas to smooth out wrinkles and deep folds on the face and can last up to a year. You can pay anywhere from $400 a syringe to $800. I pay only about $500 â€“ $550 depending on the specials the doctors have. Currently, my doctor hasÂ a buy one get one half off, and I can save the second one for a later time. At first, you may need two but, as your stem cells work, you will need less later. Â In my case, it lasts about six months. Â Remember, you get points for this with the Brilliant Distinctions Program.

These are certainly not all of the basic cosmetic procedures available, but these tend to be the least expensive and the least invasive. These procedures do well concerning anti-aging and reversing past damage.

Theyâ€™re also a good alternative to going under the knife. I think one day these products and procedures will be affordable for all of us

With todayâ€™s technology, the need for doctors to perform invasive procedures will diminish so theyâ€™ll be more eager to lower procedure costs to attract more patients. I hope that you get the best skin possible without having to figure out where you will get the money.

Letâ€™s face it, many of us want to take care of ourselves but, products and procedures can be a little expensive.

How to be happy ğŸ˜€

 

 

How to be happy at mid-life

 

First let me start off with Iâ€™m no Doctor Phil, Life Coach or anything more than just a person who has always had a pretty good life but, felt like there was something missing a lot of the time.

I felt happy most of the time but true, however, long-term happiness, eluded me. Some may call this depression, but for me, it wasnâ€™t.Â  And, it wasnâ€™t that there was always something greater and better that I was chasing either.Â  I know about watering my own grass.

I wasnâ€™t looking to escape myself and I certainly never wanted to be anyone but me.Â  Sure I could be prettier, smarter and have nicer stuff but really, does any of that make someone happy for very long?

Pretty fades, smarter becomes irrelevant, and you canâ€™t take stuff with you.

But, I always had this little hole that I couldnâ€™t fill.Â  I got some therapy; I had my share of boyfriends to fill it and, Iâ€™ve spent my way through pretty good sums of money only to end up right back to where I had always been.Â  Back to me the person with the hole.

So when I turned fifty life clicked for me.Â  I finally got it.Â  I was happy all along but, I was creating my unhappiness by the disappointment that I created about, all of the ways that I thought life should be.

The truth is, life is half chance and half results.

Blame it on the media, magazines, reality shows, parents or whatever but, how to be happy comes back to whether we are comfortable in our skin, at any stage in life. Some are luckier than others and get this sooner than I did at fifty but, never the less, I got it before it was too late.Â  Better late than never.

That was it.Â  I was never comfortable in my skin.Â  I figured at age fifty; if I wasnâ€™t comfortable by now, Iâ€™d better figure out how to get that way or figure out an exit plan because I certainly wasnâ€™t going to allow myself to grow old and bitter.

Moreover, I didnâ€™t want to walk around thinking a part of me was missing for the next half of my life.

It doesnâ€™t matter what age you are, how to be happy is about being comfortable in your skin.Â  Itâ€™s not about comparing yourself to anything other than the person that you were yesterday.Â  Not tomorrow because, you donâ€™t have that day yet and, you may never get it.

Another thing that has changed me is the acceptance that life is beautiful and, itâ€™s quick and, those that we love are here one day and gone the next.Â  Like both my mother and my brother.

Let me say that when you forget that your mom has passed away but, you pick up the phone to call her and then you realize that she is no longer there, not today, not tomorrow, not ever again, life becomes pretty sobering.

If you are fortunate to have not lost a parent, please, call them every day because, when you do,Â  youâ€™ll feel a kind of pain the hurts beyond what you thought was even possible (sorry. I know you don’t need me to tell you that).

When we realize and contemplate that we too only have a short amount of time, we donâ€™t have much time other than to be happy.Â  It is our duty to ourselves to give ourselves this gift. This is what most people will remember you for.Â  Not stuff, not your looks, not how much money you had.Â  This is your true legacy.

I know that really bad things happen in life and, these things will pass.Â  We will all die and so will the people we love.Â  We will have financial difficulties, and life will sometimes punch us so hard that it knocks the wind out and sometimes for longer than we had planned.Â  But, life goes on with or without us, and thatâ€™s just how it is.Â  This is the acceptance part that we must do.

Iâ€™m not here to give you a cheesy line about how grateful you should be. Â  Or that what you have others would probably kill to have. Â I will say that you and I should take some time every day to realize how short life is and understand that, we donâ€™t have a lot of time other than to live our lives to the fullest while we are here for the short time that we have.

There is no magic to being happy.Â  The secret is to accept the beautiful life that God has given, donâ€™t over think, add a little gratitude and, keep smiling knowing that you have this day which may be your last.

 

Change is coming

READY FOR A CHANGE?

 

 

Time for a change. Live like you mean it.

 

Change is a natural part of life and to resist it is futile. Changes occur all around us, and there is nothing we can do about it. Sometimes change is good and sometimes, as we feel a change, it may be uncomfortable, so we resist it.

Even after all the resisting we do, there comes a time when we are ready for a change. When we accept it, we listen to our inner self, possibly the one that has been talking to us our whole lives, but only now are we listening.

Itâ€™s the voice that we have always wanted to hear but didnâ€™t take its advice until now. Itâ€™s time for a change and with change comes healing and transformation.

The key to making a change is wanting to do it. Even if we fail on our journey, the more we keep trying, the higher the chance is that we will succeed. I donâ€™t need a diet to deprive myself. As soon as I say diet, I get a negative emotion that pulls me in the opposite direction, and I automatically go right back to the way I was or sometimes worse.

Sometimes instead of feeling good, I feel bad, and this is what I focus on. I realize that I donâ€™t need to live like this regularly. The fact is, I donâ€™t need to diet; I need to eat better. We as a society put so many restrictions on ourselves and when we donâ€™t succeed we punish ourselves, and the cycle continues.

I need to make a lifestyle change, thatâ€™s all. If you want to make a difference, make a change, but donâ€™t do it because of others. You know what will and will not make you a better person. This is the only change we need to make.

There is no one solution for change. Everyone is different, and it is through trial and error that we succeed. I tend to go in circles when I donâ€™t know how to make a change. This wastes so much time that I often stop trying and start again later, only to go in circles again.

Once I fall, I know why I fell, and I donâ€™t fall that way again.

Â No sense in kicking ourselves when we are down. It doesnâ€™t make sense to be defeated before we start. I have wasted a lot of time in my life, not by trying and failing, nope, I have lost more time not doing anything at all.

If you are sitting on the fence or the couch for that matter and you know itâ€™s time for a change, what are you waiting for?

Momentum kicks in in any situation when we get started. Think about when you were in school, and you had a term paper due. You may have been the kid who waited until the last minute because you didnâ€™t have a topic and you didnâ€™t know where to begin. Painfully, you waited until the last minute and got started the night before or the morning that it was due.

Itâ€™s not so much that time isnâ€™t on your side, its momentum that kicks in and you get on a roll. Once you are in this phase, you are blowing and going, and you see the end in sight. Itâ€™s just like change. You realize that itâ€™s not so hard and wonder why you didnâ€™t do it sooner. We make things harder than they need to be.

Elements of change:

Readiness, barriers, and relapse should all be expected on the road to change. We only make a change when we are ready to. I want my mom to stop smoking and take care of herself, but she is not ready to and at seventy-one, she probably never will be. (She passed away last year).

I canâ€™t do anything about it, only accept it, and she has to own it and pay the consequences. I spent a lot of years trying to get her and others to change for the better, and I was always met with resistance. It wasnâ€™t until I came to terms with the truth that no one will ever change unless they want to, not because I wanted them to.

Why I needed someone to be other than who they wanted to be, I donâ€™t know. Itâ€™s obvious when health is an issue; you want your loved ones to be around; however, if this is not what they want, itâ€™s no longer a problem for me.

When I stopped preaching to my mother, our relationship got much better. She was happy with who she was, and if this is what she chose for her time on this earth, then it is what it is.

By the way getting older is also about death and losing the ones that you love.Â  I took my momma back home to San Diego and gave her a burial at sea.Â  It was beautiful.Â  If want, you can check out the three-minute video here.Â  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qiqQrwy5crg

Barriers to change are other obstacles to overcome when we want to change. What is preventing us from changing? I will go back to my motherâ€™s story (last time I promise). Why wouldnâ€™t she want to stop smoking and get healthy so she can live longer and have a better quality of health?

I would surmise that she didn’t want to make the change because, in her mind, it would have been more painful to live without cigarettes than it is to live with them.

Itâ€™s important to know that change happens gradually. There will be a relapse, and there may be discomfort. Very few of us are so strong-willed that we wonâ€™t ever have a relapse.

There will always be factors begging for our attention. Change means being proactive and, if you are, eventually, change will be a commitment you have to yourself.Â  Also, know that you may resist what you must do but, you must do what you resist.

 

A New Way to age

 

A new way to age and live longer

 

Renewing yourself is your bodyâ€™s master plan for rejuvenation.Â  This consists of three important steps; protect, repair and rejuvenate.Â  Our bodyâ€™s renewal system prevents disease by protecting the cells and then repairing the damaged ones.Â  We have been given a specific healing system, and its mission is to achieve maximum health.

Why do we need an elaborate healing system to renew ourselves?Â  The damage that we do to ourselves and for what our environment does to us threatens our entire existence.

Renewal is a constant process in our body.Â  Just trying to repair the everyday wear and tear is bad enough but then, the renewal process must kick it up a notch should we get sick or injured.Â  Â When we have an acute or chronic condition, our body kicks into overdrive to repair the damage.

A good example of how the body can renew itself better is, if you break a bone, or cut yourself or, sustain an injury of some kind.Â  If you donâ€™t have your renewal system revved up, then it may take you a bit of time to heal, and it may not be entirely as we age.

However, if your cells are in renewal mode, then you will heal much faster.Â  Â Â Â In order to extend our lifespan, we must halt cellular damage and increase our healing system.Â  To do this, we come back to, protecting, repairing and regenerating our cells.Â  Each one of these should function to its optimal level, and if they donâ€™t then, the entire system will fail.

We already know the key to cell renewal is antioxidants because our cells are under constant attack from free radicals.Â  The damage free radicals do to cells shortens our life which means that we die before we need to due to cellular injury.

â€œA typical cell is hit by approximately twenty billion free radicals per day.â€Â Â  So long as we have enough free radicals in our body, we can fight this.Â  Think about it, twenty billion free radicals hit just one cell! And, we have so many cells.

When you get down to it, why wouldnâ€™t we help our body fight against this mass attack by consuming antioxidants and avoiding the things that cause free radicals in the first place?Â  See when we let our antioxidants fall below optimal then free radicals have the upper hand.Â  After a billion hits here and there, now you have severe cellular damage.

This type of damage not only causes disease but itâ€™s the quickest way to aging.Â  Again, how to counter this is to take in generous amounts of antioxidant foods and supplements.

How to rejuvenate your body in seven days without being rigid

Don’t worry. It’s no diet or rigidness.Â  Just something you can add to your life to make it better!

THE LOVE LIVES OF WOMEN

 

The Love Lives of women. Relationships at middle age

Â 

Ah yes, the love lives of women. Â I canâ€™t tell you how many times I hear women say, â€œThere are just no good ones left,â€ or worse, â€œI donâ€™t want a man.â€ Is this true? Even when in a relationship, married or not, we can get bored.

Iâ€™m not saying we need a man to be happy; I wonder if some women quietly settle for not having one. I realize that at middle age, there doesnâ€™t appear to be many single and qualified men out there and that the men we are married to have grown to be a bit unexciting and predictable.

I also realize the dating world is a different world out there.Â I hear stories from women who say men donâ€™t want to commit or are disrespectful. I hear about men having multiple girlfriends and lying to them about seeing other people.

I listen to others say how lonely they are and have settled for mediocre instead of holding out for the right guy. I may not understand, but I feel for those who would like to have a partner, someone to love and to love them, but itâ€™s just not happening. I feel for those who have given up, never expecting to find love at all.

Even those of us who are married, life isnâ€™t always perfect. We go through times of doubt, and question whether we want to be married, too. I think one thing is constant and that is that, the older we get, the more settled we are with ourselves. Therefore, we may be or are okay with not having a partner, and we learn to create our happiness and, more importantly, we own it, and it feels good.

Today, I took lunch to a past neighbor who is elderly and just out of the hospital after hip replacement surgery. She lives alone, has basically no family, lost her job due to age discrimination, and it is highly unlikely she will ever find another job at her age.

She has no money except Social Security and spends a dollar a day at the Dollar General store for soup to survive. I asked her if she wished she was married and how it felt being alone. I asked if she was afraid. She told me she would never want to be married for the sake of being married, and if she didnâ€™t haveÂ passion for a man, then she wouldnâ€™t want to just exist in a relationship like a lot of people do.

She also said she was very happy at this point in her life, and then genuinely laughed as though she was. The teacher has, yet again, appeared through her by showing me that, for all she doesnâ€™t have, she is still authentically happy, while I wake up each day looking for what could be better in my life.

This teacher has taught me to appreciate what I have and to stop looking for more and better. I already have it all, and there is nothing more or better that I need. Thatâ€™s the secret: if you donâ€™t need it, there is nothing missing.

 

BE YOUR BEST AT ANY AGE

 

Your best at any age

Â 

Who knows what the fountain of youth is? We all know that aging catches up with us very quickly. They say, the older you get, the faster you get old. Itâ€™s as though we wake up one day and the years have passed us by!

Youâ€™re rocking along in your life looking and feeling great and then suddenly, out of nowhere, reality hits you; you canâ€™t do the same things or look the same as you did.

Contrary to what we have been told, there is things we can do to slow down the aging process and keep ourselves on top of our game, and to, as they say, â€œage gracefully.â€

As far as I am concerned, beauty companies are liars! And we all know they are not anti-aging us, but putting moisture on top of our skin and taking our money. Like the Oil of Olay, commercial says, â€œDo you still have wrinkles even after the wrinkle cream is gone?â€ The fact of the matter is, we are going to go through many changes in our mind, body, and appearance.

Unless you have a fortune to spend on plastic surgery (even that doesnâ€™t look good after a while), you will be like the rest of us women. Your skin will age, and your body fat will shift to places you would never have imagined and you will slow down.

Is it fair? No. Can we do much about it, very little? The sooner we accept that we will age no matter what, the sooner we can move along and find peace and look our best at any age for the age we are at the time. At this point in life, we are on the last third of our lives.Â  Living life to the fullest is all you should do now.

If I could tell you one thing that will anti-age you, and it doesnâ€™t cost you a dime, and itâ€™s probably the closest to the fountain of youth you will ever know, would you want to know about it?

Of course, you do, so here it is!!!Â  It’s called EXERCISE! Thatâ€™s it! Exercise at least five days a week. You will keep your weight down and your butt where it is, and even improve upon it.

It will keep the blood pumped to your skin giving you a natural glow. People lose thirty percent of their muscle strength between the ages of fifty and seventy, and then lose another thirty percent for each decade after that.

Alarming, if you think about it because we need good muscle tone. We need to work out for balance and mobility as we get older. Â It will be even more important to maintain muscle tone as we become elderly.

The reason staying active is more important than ever is it keeps us coordinated, so we donâ€™t fall and break a hip, and it keeps the neurons in our brains firing. We need to keep our brains active to avoid dementia and to remember things like names of people, which I am very bad at. You donâ€™t have to hit the gym and run ten miles or take a cardio spinning class until you pass out either.

Iâ€™m simply talking about walking, riding a bike, swimming, or taking a dance class, and lift weights to keep your muscle tone and bones strong. Whatever you do, you must also wear sunscreen every day, as the sun is the number one reason we get wrinkles!Â  Just saying ğŸ™‚

For me, I work out, and I take in one gram of protein for every pound I weigh, and I also take supplements daily. Although I do have my bad habits, like drinking wine daily, I justify this by taking exceptionally good care of myself the rest of the time, as in eating organic, very little carbs and drinking a ton of water.Â  I not about being rigid either.Â  I would rather enjoy the time I have left and simply balance it out.

Donâ€™t forget to go to the doctor yearly, and get your mammogram.

Our cells are programmed genetically to die at a certain point and there is nothing we can do about that. However, donâ€™t underestimate “environment versus biology.”

We are in more control of our outcome then we give ourselves credit for. The goal may not be to live forever but to forever live a quality life while we are here.

LETTING GO OF EMOTIONAL PAIN

 

Letting go of emotional pain

 

Â 

Sometimes our hearts are weak, and our spirits are broken, but, still, we get up and go about the day and push down the pain. Maybe we were born with spiritual pain, or we have unresolved issues that we havenâ€™t let go of, and we hold them inside not knowing how to let go.

Some believe in past lives and that we are born with pain and this pain is a punishment from a past life.

For those who are Christian, they donâ€™t believe this, but believe that we can remove the pain by giving it to God. Give it to something or someone and let it go if you have it. Itâ€™s not worth holding on to. Without being mindful, we hold on to pain so tight that it leaves us exhausted.

Â I am not saying things didnâ€™t happen to you in your past. Maybe you canâ€™t even remember or pinpoint anything. I couldnâ€™t imagine some of the circumstances people have gone through and are still able to live each day.

I have had hardships, but I am blessed that my pain is not as deep as others.Â  All pain needs to be let go of, though. The point here is to give yourself the gift of seeking out help to rid yourself if you are in pain. Start fresh again, even if for only once in your life. Choose to be free.

Listen to your pain; itâ€™s telling you something, telling you that you must do something about it. The problem is that we feel it, but we donâ€™t acknowledge it. Just like a broken leg tells you itâ€™s broken, your spirit also tells you itâ€™s broken too.

The pain that we carry around could be minimal, or it could be monumental. I have heard that what doesnâ€™t kill us, makes us stronger, and that suffering causes greatness. I donâ€™t necessarily believe this as I believe it leaves pain wounds in our soul and, unless we intentionally choose to heal it, we have a problem.

Most of us think we are healing our pain by getting better at handling it. To solve your inner problems is to quit letting your mind mislead you. I donâ€™t think time heals all wounds either. Time makes them a little easier to take, but we all know if we let ourselves go there, we can bring back the pain like it was day one. How we do this is by holding in that exact memory of when we first arrived at the pain. We can go back there again and again if we let ourselves.

When we think no one will love us and we are alone, or we will always be alone, or there will never be someone for us, we are dealing with our minds personal dilemma. When we do find someone, and the relationship doesnâ€™t solve the issues that we have, we have an internal disturbance. We realize the void is still within us, and then we move onto something else because the pain is always there. But the real problem is we take our baggage wherever we go, and we want to give it to someone else to carry, all the while picking up more as we go along.

Freeing ourselves from pain is a matter of unloading the memory and detaching the connection we have to it and then allowing it to diminish. It will take time, and it will take a conscious effort to do it, but it can be done. If you have lost a loved one, you will have pain. In time it will get better. You will always have the good memories.

Â There are no boundaries that we must live in, just the ones we create.

Real growth means dealing with discomfort, like it or not. Many times the actions we take are to avoid something. Stop avoiding and donâ€™t let issues upset you. If you are avoiding pain and you encounter what you canâ€™t avoid, then walk alongside it until it passes. And, if you do nothing else, donâ€™t take things personally. Much of what goes on around you has absolutely nothing to do with you,

Controlling the middle-age weight gain!

 

How to keep your weight down at middle age

9 Ways To Not Over Eat

 

Iâ€™m going to admit it! Â I way overeat and then wonder why I feel bad both physically and mentally.

I do good for a while, and then I decide that I want pizza, pasta or fries! Â I eat healthy about 80% of the time, and that used to be just fine when I was younger, but now, itâ€™s not so good.

I could eat 80% clean and then 20% bad but, itâ€™s come down to either my metabolism is slowing down as Iâ€™ve gotten older or, Iâ€™m eating way more food than I want to believe.

So, I have decided that Iâ€™m not going up a clothing size and, Iâ€™m for sure not going to increase my workouts from five days to seven days so, the only thing left to do (other than give in a eat whatever the hell I want) is to stop overeating!

 

Here are theÂ 9 Ways To Not Over Eat:

 

9 ways to not overeat

Do you have a thyroid problem?

 

At home thyroid test

 

At home test below:

 

Itâ€™s believed by many doctors that our basal metabolic temperature or BMT is the most accurate measure of thyroid function.

We can check our own BMT at home by using an oral thermometer.Â  Not a digital one.

 

This is how you do it:

Note: Â Please do not use this as medical advice. Â Please see your doctor for a proper diagnosis.

  1. When you are ready to go to bed, shake an oral thermometer down and put it next to your bed where you can easily reach it in the morning. Donâ€™t shake it down in the morning because this can raise your body temperature and the test wonâ€™t be accurate.
  2. When you wake up in the morning, put the thermometer in your armpit and leave it there for 10 minutes. Try and lie as still as you can.Â  Donâ€™t get up or move as this too will increase your metabolic rate thus, raising your temperature.
  3. After the 10 minutes are up, record your temperature.
  4. Repeat this process for 3 â€“ 5 days (at least 3 but preferably 5).

If your BMT consistently falls below 97.8 F, you may have an underactive thyroid.Â  BMT Normally ranges from 97.8 F to 98.2 F.

**If you have any kind of infection wait to take the test.

If you fall below and you have some of the symptoms below, it may be time to see your doctor for a blood test.
